Description:
The AllergyIntolerance resource defines clinical information about a patient's allergic response to a substance. It defines the substance that elicited the response, as well as when the reaction occurred, the severity, and the type of reaction noted. The AllergyIntolerance resource can also accommodate search by ID and by patient, allowing it to return a list of allergies. If a patient has no active allergies, an AllergyIntolerance resource will be returned indicating whether the patient's allergies have never been reviewed (are not on file), or if they have been reviewed and it has been determined that they have no known allergies.

This resource can also return unconfirmed AllergyIntolerance resources in the "holding tank" that drives the EpicCare Reconcile Outside Data Activity. Note - once a clinician reconciles an allergy, a new AllergyIntolerance resource associated with the reconciled allergy will be available in the normal AllergyIntolerance.Search results, and the unconfirmed AllergyIntolerance in the "holding tank" will no longer appear in the AllergyIntolerance.Search results.

clinical-status.Name: clinical-status
clinical-status.Description:
The current status of the allergy. Only "active" is accepted.

Starting in the August 2021 version of Epic, this parameter is no longer required, and if is not specified, both active and inactive/resolved allergies are returned.
clinical-status.Optional: Optional in Epic August 2021 and later. Required in earlier versions.

Bundle.Name: Bundle
Bundle.Description: Resource bundle. For more information, refer to the FHIR specification.

category.Name: category
category.Description:
The category of the allergy.

The following default values are supported, but additional values may be configured by each Epic organization:

  • food
  • medication
  • environment
  • biologic

Starting in the May 2021 version of Epic, multiple category values can be returned in this element.

clinicalStatus.Name: clinicalStatus
clinicalStatus.Description:
The current status of the allergy. Possible values include:

  • active
  • resolved
  • inactive

If no known allergies on file, value will be "active".

criticality.Name: criticality
criticality.Description:
Refers to the risk of clinical harm of a reaction to the substance. Possible values are:

  • unable-to-assess
  • high
  • low

note.Name: note
note.Description: Any comments associated with the allergy.

onsetPeriod.Name: onsetPeriod
onsetPeriod.Description: If an allergy has a noted date or a resolved date, those dates are specified here.

patient.Name: patient
patient.Description: Reference to a patient resource for whom the allergy is relevant.

reaction.Name: reaction
reaction.Description: List of known reactions the patient had to the substance.

manifestation.Name: manifestation
manifestation.Description: A single reaction the patient had to the substance.

severity.Name: severity
severity.Description:
The degree of the patient's reaction. Possible values are:

  • mild
  • moderate
  • severe

recordedDate.Name: recordedDate
recordedDate.Description: The date the allergy was recorded in Epic. Called "assertedDate" in STU3.

recorder.Name: recorder
recorder.Description: Reference to the practitioner who updated the allergy.

verificationStatus.Name: verificationStatus
verificationStatus.Description:
The current status of the allergy. Possible values include:

  • active
  • resolved
  • inactive

If no known allergies on file, value will be "active".

total.Name: total
total.Description: Total number of resources that matched the search criteria.
